talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>I'm not gonna do it for free!</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Merchant Farrah$
Hehehe, I'm so busy today as usual. {user_nick}, won't you help me out, sweetheart?

$Merchant Farrah$
Hehehe, you're a polite young thing. It's a very simple task. But even the simplest thing can be a wish of a lifetime to someone else too.

$Merchant Farrah$
Hehehe, you know how life works! It's a very simple task. But even the simplest thing can be a wish of a lifetime to someone else.

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>A book? What's the title of the book? </html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Merchant Farrah$
Hehehe, don't worry it's a simple task. I know that you're the adventurer who can enter the Forest of Little Shadows.
Will you go to the Passage of Broken Recollections and find a little book for this old lady?

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>A bookmark? Do I need to open every single book there...?</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Merchant Farrah$
The book has no name, and is empty too.
But I know that a young flower is pressed between the pages as a bookmark.

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>I don't think it has anything to do with age...</html>
<html>Being young doesn't mean I can do anything.</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Merchant Farrah$
Hehehe! That's the hard part. An old granny like me can't open all the books, but a young child like you can open dozens of books with ease.

$Merchant Farrah$
Besides, I know I can count on you. There's something called intuition that you gain from years of experience. Hehehe... Won't you do me this favour? I can ask a cheaper adventurer to do it but my merchant's intuition tells me to give the job to you.
I will pay you handsomely.
<html>$The 17th Princess$</html>

$Merchant Farrah$
Hehehe, I knew you'd take the job…!
When you find a forget-me-not between the pages, that's the book. Hehehe… (Farrah smiles strangely. Go to the Passage of Broken Recollections and find the book)

${user_nick}$
(All the books are up there. Shall I climb up?)
*All the party members will be moved when you finish the conversation.

${user_nick}$
(I'll search that place later)

${user_nick}$
(Move)

*You can climb up or down by clicking the bookcase.
*If you are already near the bookcase, you can't go down if there's a party member who has a task to do at the bookcase.

${user_nick}$
(You feel dizzy looking at the bookcase full of books... One of the books on the floor catches your eyes. When you pick it up and open it, you find a withered forget-me-not... That's lucky... Is this the intuition that Farrah talked about?!)

${user_nick}$
(You browse the book to see if there's anything written in it, but it's empty. As you close the book with disappointment, small blurred words can be seen on the cover)

${user_nick}$
(It says..."Don't forget that day"... That's the only thing you can see from this book.
Take the book to Farrah.)

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>I had such a hard time looking for it! </html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Merchant Farrah$
Hehehe... You really brought it. Did you look for it for a long time?

$Merchant Farrah$
Hehehe! Of course, not everyone can be good adventurers. Hehehe! But don't be too honest all the time. But you can be honest with me since I'm a nice old lady. Hehehe...

$Merchant Farrah$
Hehehe, is that right? Bluffing works only on those who will buy your farce. Hehehe. Of course, it would probably work on novice adventurers! Hehehe...

$Merchant Farrah$
Yeah, who would take this empty book or even be interested in it? But...
(Farrah sprinkles some powder and words start to appear vaguely)

$Merchant Farrah$
Hehehe, there's magic cast on this book indeed. It should take some time for all the words to appear since the book is quite old...
I wanted to read this book to you but I guess I should at least tell you the story in the version that I know.

$Merchant Farrah$
Hehehe, here it goes. This book is about Princess Elizabeth, the Forget-me-not Princess.

$Merchant Farrah$
It may be considered a blessing to be born into the royal family, but everything must have made it feel like life is a curse for a princess who lost her mother immediately when she was born. Besides, her mother was a concubine who was an eyesore to the queen...

$Merchant Farrah$
She was a poor thing from a nameless family... The king took a liking to her and made her his concubine. Her first child was a boy but he died at a young age and her second child was Elizabeth. But this time, the mother died and left the young princess all alone. No one knows if her death was a natural one, hehehe.

$Merchant Farrah$
"Forget-me-not Princess" was a derogatory nickname at that time. Normally, princesses were named after precious stones...

$Merchant Farrah$
Poor lady Elizabeth couldn't even take a step into the palace. She met her father for a brief moment only during the new year celebrations.
The lonely lady who grew up in a cabin all alone, but one day she met a wandering sorceress and started learning magic from her... That was the only thing she could do to pass time. Hehehe.

$Merchant Farrah$
She was clever and beautiful. But a royal family member learning magic wasn't welcomed back in those days. She suffered from persecutions just because she was a sorceress, but things took a different turn when her magic skills started to become better and better.

$Merchant Farrah$
The sorceresses united to back Elizabeth and she managed to gain enough power to enter the palace. However, she returned to her cabin in just a few days. Her wicked brothers and sisters in the palace bullied her in all the childish ways you can think of.

$Merchant Farrah$
No one knows if her father knew about it or not, but Elizabeth was back in her cabin and she started using her power and magic to help the people around her. Her popularity among the commoners soared. But her nasty brothers and sisters must have been displeased with that too. She was married off to a rogue knight.

$Merchant Farrah$
Everyone thought her life would be miserable, but...
Her life became even happier! Everyone was so stunned, even the sorceresses. No one expected such an outcome.

$Merchant Farrah$
Hehehe... When everyone talked about how lucky the princess was, the sorceress who used to teach her magic knew that wasn't luck and wanted the world to know the truth about her. She wasn't born lucky. The princess desperately strove for her own happiness.

$Merchant Farrah$
The princess happily agreed on writing her biography, and the vagrant sorceress recorded everything about the princess' life.
But the sorceress ended up getting despised by other sorceresses... She had fallen in love with a cleric.

$Merchant Farrah$
She was expelled out of the country,
and she never met Elizabeth again.

$Merchant Farrah$
Of course, Elizabeth was furious when she found out the truth about what happened, but she couldn't do anything.
That sorceress had disappeared to a faraway place and it wasn't easy for Elizabeth to leave the country too...

$Merchant Farrah$
So what Elizabeth did was...
She filled her old cabin with forget-me-nots. Though it's presumed that it had something to do with her nickname, it is not certain...

$Merchant Farrah$
Anyway, forget-me-nots bloomed in and out of the cabin, and the place became famous for being the old house of the princess.
It became so famous that the sorceress who was in a faraway land heard about this too.

$Merchant Farrah$
Perhaps that was the reason why she continued to write the biography of the lovely princess.
More records about Princess Elizabeth can be found in various small towns rather than in Saint Haven.

$Merchant Farrah$
As a sign that she didn't forget Elizabeth either, she pressed forget-me-nots in her books and used them as bookmarks. Maybe Elizabeth heard about this too... All her dresses were embroidered or decorated with the flower.

talk_paragraph.talk_answer: <html>I didn't know there was such a story...</html>
talk_paragraph.talk_question:
$Merchant Farrah$
They both showed that they remained in each other's heart but... They never met again. Hehehe...
What a sad ending.

$Merchant Farrah$
Hehehe, anyway I was eyeing this book after finding out that it was at the Passage of Broken Recollections. If the words on this book appear, I'll show it to you.
<html>$Quest Completed$</html>

$Merchant Farrah$
Though flowers and jewels are pretty, there's something more beautiful in this world. Heheheh!!
(Farrah bursts into a weird laughter)

journal.title: The 17th Princess 1
journal.contents:
Farrah asked you to find a book at a place with many books in Passage of Broken Recollections.
Go to the Passage of Broken Recollections to find the book. It must be at a place with many bookcases.

Anu Arendel (Forest of Little Shadows) - Passage of Broken Recollections (Bookcase)
journal.destination: Find the book at the Passage of Broken Recollections
journal.todo_msg: Go to the Passage of Broken Recollections and find the book.

journal.title: The 17th Princess 2
journal.contents:
You've reached a place with many books. Find the book.

Anu Arendel (Forest of Little Shadows) - Passage of Broken Recollections (The Book)
journal.destination: Find the book at the Passage of Broken Recollections
journal.todo_msg: You've come to a place with many bookcases. Find the book.

journal.title: The 17th Princess 3
journal.contents:
You've found the book. Take it to Farrah.

Anu Arendel - Merchant Farrah
journal.todo_msg: You've found the book. Take it to Farrah.
